question.title: How to serialize/deserialize JMH result to compare baseline with feature code
question.body:
My requirement: I want to execute JMH tests that will benchmark the performance of my code baseline, save the results in a file and upload to a server. When the same test is executed from a feature branch on the CI, this file will be read and current result will be compared to the result of baseline, and fail if it is longer than a predefined threshold.

Is there a way/class to serialise the result of a JMH test result, that can be deserialized easily ? I know I can output multiple formats, but I did not find any Utility class that allows me to deserialize/parse those formats directly.

Note: I know I can just get a specific number of the result object and persist only that as a double object, but I want the whole result that contains multiple different statistics so I can play with them and do a more complete comparison. That is why I am looking for a way to persist the whole result object.

Any help is appreciated, and thanks in advance !

I have already checked this question, the logic is the same but there is no answer for the implementation details.
